landing.descOne: NEAR Wallet is a secure wallet and account manager for your accounts on the NEAR blockchain.

note.canContain: Your account ID can contain any of the following:
note.separators: Characters (_-) can be used as separators

createAccount.pageText: Enter an Account ID to use with your NEAR account. Your Account ID will be used for all NEAR operations, including sending and receiving assets.

generatePassphrase.desc: For the best security, we recommend generating a unique passphrase for each new account in your wallet.
generatePassphrase.descTwo: As a more convenient option, you may instead share an existing passphrase between multiple accounts. You can change this at any time.

sharedPassphrase.desc: Your passphrase has been verified! Once you’ve funded your new address, your passphrase will be shared by ${numberOfAccounts} accounts.
sharedPassphrase.descTwo: Whenever this passphrase is used to recover your wallet, the following accounts will be imported:

verifyPassphrase.desc: Enter an existing passphrase below to secure your new account.

lockedBalance: This NEAR is locked in a lockup contract, and cannot be withdrawn. You may still delegate or stake this NEAR. Once the NEAR is unlocked, you can view it in your Unlocked Balance, and chose to withdraw it (moving to your Available Balance).

migration.message: Soon NEAR wallet (wallet.near.org) will no longer be supported. Transfer your accounts to a different wallet or export your private keys from account settings.
migration.redirect: Soon NEAR wallet (wallet.near.org) will no longer be supported. Use your 12-word recovery phrase to import your account(s) to a different wallet or recover and export your account(s).

minimumBalance: This is the minimum NEAR balance your account must maintain to remain active. This balance represents the storage space your account is using on the NEAR blockchain (with a small buffer), and will go up or down as you use more or less space.

importCode.desc: If you are already logged in on a desktop device, scan your mobile access code to import your account.

showCode.desc: Scan your mobile access code to grant full account access to your mobile device.

modal.desc: Reveal and scan the QR code below to import your account on your mobile device.
modal.disclaimer: This code contains highly sensitive data and grants full account access to your mobile device. Take care not to share or expose it, and only import your account to a secure device that you own.
modal.title: Mobile Access Code

networkBanner.desc: This wallet (and network) are for testing purposes only. Tokens and other assets have no value. Accounts created do not transfer to Mainnet.

security.lessSecureDesc: These options are recommended for accounts with small amounts of NEAR and other assets. They are convenient, but do present additional risk to the more secure options. If your email account or SMS messages are compromised, your funds might be at risk.
security.mostSecureDesc: Ledger is the most secure option. Passphrases can be secure if used correctly (they must be written down and stored safely).
security.title: Security & Recovery

profile.twoFactorDesc: Authenticate with SMS or email when authorizing transactions and/or signing in to your account.

reCAPTCHA.disclaimer: This site is protected by reCAPTCHA and the Google Privacy Policy and Terms of Service apply.

fail.desc: reCAPTCHA is required in order to authorize new accounts funded by NEAR.

recoverAccount.actionRequired: This message contains a magic link. Click the link to begin recovery!
recoverAccount.cannotResend: This message was sent when you enabled email/phone recovery. We only send this message once, and cannot resend it.

phrase.desc: Make sure you have your 12 word recovery phrase, then click below to begin the recovery process.

desc.ledger: We couldn't find any active account(s) using the provided Ledger key. This could be because the account has no activity yet.
desc.phrase: We couldn't find any active account(s) using the provided passphrase. This could be because the passphrase is incorrect, or because the account has no activity yet.

recoverWithLink.errorP: Please check your email or phone for the most recent message. Links in all earlier messages are invalid.

recoveryMgmt.unsupportedMethodEmail: We're removing support for email as recovery method. Once you've disabled this method, you will not be able to re-enable it.
recoveryMgmt.unsupportedMethodPhone: We're removing support for SMS as recovery method. Once you've disabled this method, you will not be able to re-enable it.

Public key access was rejected. No accounts were recovered.

releaseNotesModal.desc: You asked, we listened! The latest update brings adjustments to how balances are displayed in the wallet, and an easier way to create new accounts.
releaseNotesModal.subText1: During on-boarding, you may now use an SMS capable phone number to verify and initialize your new account. Users who don’t wish to provide this information may still initialize new accounts with an initial deposit.
releaseNotesModal.subText2: The primary balance displayed in the wallet is now your 'Available Balance', where it was previously your 'Total Balance'. The Available Balance offers the most utility to users wanting to know at a glance what they have available to spend/stake/and interact with the ecosystem; it does not include any tokens that are not readily spendable, such as tokens that are staked.  You can still see your staked tokens balance details on the 'Account' and 'Staking' screens.
releaseNotesModal.title: Release Notes

removeAccount.desc: You will need your recovery method to re-import this account in the future. Make sure you still have access to it.
removeAccount.disclaimer: I have access to the recovery method for ${accountId}
removeAccount.title: Remove Account?

removeLinkRecovery.desc: We have updated our security measures to protect your account. Please enable a passphrase or Ledger recovery method and disable all email and SMS recovery methods to ensure your account is protected. Learn more.
removeLinkRecovery.title: Important Security Update

reservedForFeesInfo: Up to ${data} NEAR is reserved to cover the cost of transactions.

riscScoring.checkbox: I accept responsibility for sending funds to this address.
riscScoring.scamWarning: This address has a high level of risk and marked as scam. Make sure that this address is safe before sending funds.

selectAccountDropdown.switchAccounthNotAllowed: This app doesn't allow account changes

amountStatusId.howMuch: How much do you want to send?
amountStatusId.notEnoughTokens: You must leave at least ${amount} NEAR in your account

banner.insufficient: You are attempting to send your entire available balance. At least ${data} NEAR must be reserved to cover transaction fees.
banner.useMax: A small portion (${data} NEAR) of your available balance has been reserved to cover transaction fees.

sendMoney.onceConfirmed: Once confirmed, this cannot be undone.

subtitle.default: Enter the amount of NEAR to send, and the account ID to send it to.

translateIdInfoTooltip.estimatedFees: The estimated cost of processing your transaction.
translateIdInfoTooltip.estimatedTotal: The estimated total of your transaction including fees.
translateIdInfoTooltip.networkFees: The final amount paid to cover the costs of processing your transaction.
translateIdInfoTooltip.reservedForFees: The portion of your account balance that cannot be spent. This amount is reserved to cover the storage costs of your account. For more information, visit our documentation.

setupLedger.one: Connect your Ledger Nano S or X to your computer or mobile device via USB and open the NEAR application.
setupLedger.two: If you have not yet installed the NEAR Ledger app, follow

setupLedgerSteps.five: Select the device from the list in the second pop-up and select Connect.
setupLedgerSteps.four: On the first pop-up window, select the Connect button.
setupLedgerSteps.header: Install NEAR on your Ledger device
setupLedgerSteps.install: If you have not yet installed the NEAR Ledger app, follow
setupLedgerSteps.one: Connect your Ledger via USB to your computer.
setupLedgerSteps.six: Select the Continue button below to finish setting up the Ledger on this account.
setupLedgerSteps.three: Select the Connect Ledger button at the top right of the window.
setupLedgerSteps.two: Open the NEAR app on the Ledger.

one.keep: Maintaining multiple recovery methods and devices increases the vulnerability of your account.
one.remove: Before removing your existing keys and recovery methods, make sure that you have recorded and securely stored your Ledger passphrase.

two.remove: If you lose access to your passphrase, NEAR Inc. will be unable to assist you in recovery of your account and its funds.

setupLedgerSuccess.one: We recommend that you remove all existing keys (recovery methods and devices).
setupLedgerSuccess.primaryCta: Remove Existing Keys and Recovery Methods
setupLedgerSuccess.two: Maintaining multiple keys and recovery methods (including passphrases) increases the vulnerability of your account.

setupRecovery.advancedSecurityDesc: Write down a 12 word passphrase, or secure your account with your Ledger device.
setupRecovery.basicSecurityDesc: Enter your email address or phone number and receive a magic link
setupRecovery.emailDesc: Receive a verification code and account recovery link via email.
setupRecovery.existingPhraseDesc: Protect your new address by sharing an existing passphrase.
setupRecovery.ledgerDesc: Secure your account with a Ledger hardware device.
setupRecovery.newPhraseDesc: Protect your new address with a new and unique passphrase.
setupRecovery.notSupportedPhone: Unfortunately, we do not offer SMS for your region. Please choose email instead.
setupRecovery.phoneDesc: Receive a verification code and account recovery link via SMS.
setupRecovery.phraseDesc: Generate and safely store a unique passphrase.
setupRecovery.subHeader: Select a method to secure and recover your account. This will be used to verify important activity, recover your account and access your account from other devices.

setupSeedPhrase.pageText: Write down the following words in order and keep them somewhere safe. Anyone with access to it will also have access to your account! You’ll be asked to verify your passphrase next.

setupSeedPhraseSuccess.pageText: Use your Recovery Phrase to restore your account.
setupSeedPhraseSuccess.pageTextSecondLine: Anyone with access to your Recovery Phrase can access your funds, so keep it offline somewhere safe and secure.

setupSeedPhraseVerify.inputError: Please check your passphrase and try again.
setupSeedPhraseVerify.pageText: Enter the following word from your recovery phrase to complete the setup process.

accountNotFound.body:
${signCallbackUrl} is requesting authorization from a NEAR account that cannot be found: ${signTransactionSignerId}

To approve any transactions, you’ll first need to import the account.
accountNotFound.title: Account Not Found

ActionWarrning.deleteAccount: You are about to delete your account! Your NEAR balance will be destroyed, and all of your account data deleted.
ActionWarrning.deployContract: You are about to deploy a contract to your account! This contract can access your NEAR balance, and interact with other contracts on your behalf.
ActionWarrning.functionCall: No description specified for this function.
ActionWarrning.stake: You are about to stake NEAR tokens. These tokens will be locked, and are at risk of being lost if your validator becomes unresponsive.

sign.hereAreSomeDetails: Here are some details that will help you.
sign.insufficientFundsDesc: You do not have enough available NEAR to complete this transaction.

invalidTransaction.body: The request is invalid and cannot be signed.
invalidTransaction.title: Invalid Transaction

multipleAccountsError.body:
${signCallbackUrl} has requested authorization from more than one account.

NEAR Wallet may only authorize transactions for a single account at a time.
multipleAccountsError.title: Batch Transaction Error

retry.text:
The default network fee was not enough to cover the cost of your transaction.

You may resubmit the transaction to have its fee limit automatically increased.
retry.title: Insufficient Network Fee

advanced.desc: Specify an HD path to import its linked accounts.
advanced.exportDesc:
Specify an HD path to export your account to, you’ll need to remember your choice to use this account in the future.
For additional security use different HD paths for each unique account.
advanced.subTitle: HD Path
advanced.title: Advanced Options

firefoxBanner.desc: Ledger is currently only supported in Mozilla Firefox. Support for other browsers will soon be restored.

signInLedger.header: Authorize NEAR Wallet to import your accounts.

modal.ledgerMustAdd: Ledger must add an access key for each account protected by your device:

signInLedger.one: Before importing your accounts, you’ll need to grant NEAR Wallet permission to access them.

stagingBanner.desc: Warning: This is a pre-release version of the NEAR Wallet. There may be bugs, and these bugs may lead to loss of funds. By continuing to use this version, you agree that you understand and accept these risks, and understand that the NEAR Wallet team will be unable to help you.
stagingBanner.title: Warning: This is a pre-release version of Wallet. Use at your own risk!

stakedBalance: This NEAR is actively being used to back a validator and secure the network. When you decide to unstake this NEAR, it will take some time to be shown in your Available Balance, as NEAR takes 4 epochs (~52-65 hours) to unstake.

alertBanner.title: You must first unstake and withdraw your tokens from your current validator in order to stake with a new validator.

available.info: These tokens have been unstaked, and are ready to be withdrawn.
available.title: Available for withdrawal

farm.info: This validator grants staking rewards in a token other than NEAR.

farmed.info: Collected tokens that have been earned during farming with farming validators.
farmed.title: Available for claim

pending.info: These tokens have been unstaked, but are not yet ready to withdraw. Tokens are ready to withdraw 52 to 65 hours after unstaking.
pending.title: Pending release

staked.info: NEAR tokens currently staked with validators. These tokens are accumulating rewards. To access these tokens, you must first unstake and then withdraw them.
staked.title: Total amount staked

unclaimed.info: Rewards that have been earned, but not withdrawn. NEAR token rewards are compounding and are automatically re-staked.
unclaimed.title: Rewards earned

unavailable.modalDescOne: We are currently unable to calculate rewards when Two-Factor Authentication is enabled. We hope to enable this functionality in the near future.
unavailable.modalDescTwo: In the meantime, you will be able to see your rewards accumulating under ”Total amount staked”. This balance will grow while your tokens are staked, since your rewards are automatically re-staked with your current validator.
unavailable.modalTitle: Unable to display staking rewards earned
unavailable.title: Unable to display rewards earned.

claimSuccess.desc: Tokens have been successfully claimed from the validator
claimSuccess.title: Success!

noValidators.title: You are not currently staking with any validators.

staking.pageText: Setup your Node via CLI, then add it here.

stake.accounts: If you have locked NEAR, you can choose to stake with either your locked NEAR (lockup.near), or your unlocked NEAR (your account name). You will only see the staking positions for the selected account. If you do not have locked NEAR, you can ignore this section

banner.insufficientBalance: You are attempting to stake your entire available balance. At least ${data} NEAR must be reserved to cover transaction fees.
banner.stakeMax: A small portion (${data} NEAR) of your available balance has been reserved to cover transaction fees.

stake.desc: Enter the amount you would like to stake with your chosen validator.
stake.ledgerDisclaimer: Note: Since this is your first time staking with this validator, you will need to confirm two transactions.
stake.title: Stake Amount

stakeSuccess.desc: Your stake has successfully been delegated to your chosen validator:
stakeSuccess.descTwo: You can now view your delegation and staking rewards from your staking dashboard.
stakeSuccess.title: Success!

staking.desc: Stake your NEAR tokens with a validator
staking.noValidators: You haven't staked with a validator yet.
staking.title: Staking

unstake.beforeUnstakeDisclaimer: Unstaked tokens will be made available pending a release period of ~52-65hrs (4 epochs).
unstake.desc: Enter the number of tokens you would like to unstake from your current validator.
unstake.title: Unstake Tokens

unstakeSuccess.desc: ${amount} has successfully been unstaked from this validator:
unstakeSuccess.descTwo: Your tokens are pending release and will be made available within ~52-65hrs (4 epochs).
unstakeSuccess.title: Success!

validator.desc: This is the fee paid to the validator to stake on your behalf. This fee is only charged on your rewards.
validator.errorClaimRewards: Something went wrong during claiming your farm rewards. Please, try again later
validator.notWhitelistedTokenWarning: This token has not been whitelisted by ref-finance. Proceed at your own risk.
validator.notWhitelistedValidatorWarning: Tokens awarded by this validator have not been whitelisted by ref-finance. Proceed at your own risk.
validator.title:
Validator:
${validator}
validator.withdrawalDisclaimer: Funds pending release will be made available after ~52-65hrs (4 epochs)

desc.account: Enter a known validator or select a validator from the list to stake your NEAR tokens.
desc.lockup: Enter a known validator or select a validator from the list to stake your NEAR tokens. You may only stake with a single validator at any given time.
desc.unstake: Select the validator pool from which you wish to unstake your tokens.
desc.withdraw: Select the validator pool from which you wish to withdraw your tokens.

stakingPoolUnstaked: This NEAR is currently in a staking pool but unstaked. It could for example be in a pending release state.

swap.successTitle:
Transaction complete!
You swapped ${amountFrom}
to ${amountTo}
swap.title: Swap

translateIdInfoTooltip.fee: The estimated cost of processing your transaction.
translateIdInfoTooltip.minimumReceived: The minimum amount you will receive from the trade.
translateIdInfoTooltip.priceImpact: The difference between the market price and estimated price due to trade size.
translateIdInfoTooltip.slippage: The percentage the price may increase before the transaction fails.

topLevelAccounts.body: Account names are similar to domain names. Only the ${data} account can create accounts such as yourname.${data}, and only yourname.${data} can create app.yourname.${data}. All accounts created in this wallet use the .${data} Top Level Account (TLA). To learn more about account names and creating your own TLA, visit the docs.

totalBalance: Your total balance represents all NEAR tokens under your control. In many cases, you will not have immediate access to this entire balance (e.g. if it is locked, delegated, or staked). Check your Available Balance for the NEAR you can actively use, transfer, delegate, and stake.

addKey.full: Entering the code below will authorize full access to your NEAR account: ${accountId} If you did not initiate this action, please DO NOT continue.
addKey.limited: Adding key ${publicKey} limited to call ${methodNames} on ${receiverId} and spend up to ${allowance} NEAR on gas

action.functionCall:
Calling method: ${methodName} in contract: ${receiverId} with amount ${deposit} NEAR and with args: 
${args}

alertBanner.title: When enabled, ${data} will be locked to cover the contract storage costs of two-factor authentication.

twoFactor.checkBox: I acknowledge that by enabling two-factor authentication, ${amount} will be reserved to cover contract storage.
twoFactor.desc: Protect your account by requiring confirmation via SMS or email when authorizing transactions.

disable.desc: Keep in mind that transactions won't have to be confirmed with 2FA once it's disabled.
disable.phoneDesc: The SMS option for two-factor authentication is being deprecated, and cannot be re-enbaled.
disable.title: Are you sure you want to disable 2FA?

twoFactor.notEnoughBalance: To enable 2FA, your account requires a minimum available balance of ${amount}
twoFactor.promptDesc: We highly recommend that you set up a two-factor authentication method to increase the security of your account and assets
twoFactor.subHeader: Two factor authentication adds an extra layer of security to your account. Passphrase and Ledger keys continue to allow full access to your account.
twoFactor.title: Two-Factor Authentication

verify.desc: A 6-digit verification code has been sent to:
verify.title: Enter Two-Factor Verification Code

twoFactorDisableLocked.descOne: We couldn’t verify your 2FA method for
twoFactorDisableLocked.descTwo: If you can no longer access your account, you can rotate your keys and recover it. You will need your secure passphrase to unlock your account.
twoFactorDisableLocked.title: Is your account locked?

twoFactorDisbleBanner.desc: NEAR wallet (wallet.near.org) will soon remove support for two-factor authentication, please disable 2FA for your connected accounts.

twoFactorRemoveAuth.desc: Enter your secure passphrase to remove 2FA from the account:
twoFactorRemoveAuth.title: Remove Two-Factor Authentication?

unlockedAvailTransfer: This NEAR is unlocked, and can be transferred out of your lockup contract.
unlockedBalance: This NEAR is still in a lockup contract, but unlocked.
unvestedBalance: Unvested NEAR is earmarked to you, but not yet under your ownership. You can still delegate or stake this NEAR, and the rewards will be entirely yours. As your NEAR is vested, it will appear in either your Locked or Unlocked balance.

verifyAccount.desc: To prevent spamming of new accounts, we'll need to verify you as the owner. You may verify using a one-time passcode or by making a small initial deposit.
verifyAccount.descNoFunding: Choose a method below to fund and initialize your new account.

email.desc: You'll need to use a different email address or select an alternate method to verify this account. You may still use this address as a recovery method.
email.title: This email address has already been used to verify a different account.

phone.desc: You'll need to use a different phone number or select an alternate method to verify this account. You may still use this number as a recovery method.
phone.title: This phone number has already been used to verify a different account.

creditCard.desc: Purchase NEAR through MoonPay to be used as your initial deposit.
creditCard.title: Fund with a Credit Card

email.desc: Receive a one-time verification code via email.
email.title: Email

existingAccount.desc: Use an existing account to fund and initialize your new account.
existingAccount.title: Fund with an existing account

manualDeposit.desc: Submit a manual deposit via a single-use funding address.
manualDeposit.title: Manual deposit

phone.desc: Receive a one-time verification code via SMS.
phone.title: Phone

verifyAccount.title: Almost there! Verify your new account.
verifyAccount.titleNoFunding: Almost there! Fund your new account.

invalidRequest.body: The request is invalid and cannot be signed.
invalidRequest.title: Invalid Transaction

summary.permissions: Verify your account using your profile name and wallet address.
summary.title: Authorization Request

verifyWalletDomainBanner.title: Please make sure you are visiting

depositNear.desc: You’ll need NEAR tokens to perform transactions with your wallet.
depositNear.title: Deposit NEAR

addAccessKey.error:
An error has occurred.
To access your account, please enter the passphrase from the previous step below.

addAccessKeySeedPhrase.errorSecond:
An error has occurred.
The passphrase was not added to your account. Please try again.

addAccessKeyZeroBalanceAccountSetup.error: Something went wrong while finishing import of your now active account. Please re-import your account in the wallet.

addLedgerAccessKey.2faEnabled: Two-Factor Authentication is enabled. To enable Ledger Hardware Wallet you need to disable Two-Factor Authentication first.

addLedgerAccountId.errorRpc: Error appears while recovering the account.

connectLedger.noClient: Ledger is not connected yet. Please connect ledger first.

accountCreated.error: Account creation succeeded but an error occurred. Please import your account.

accountExists.error: Account creation failed. Account already exists.

createNewAccount.error: Account creation failed. You may want to try again.

walletErrorCodes.emailProviderInvalid: ${domainName} cannot be used for account verification.  Please provide an e-mail address from a different email provider.

getLedgerAccountIds.noAccounts: No accounts were found for this Ledger device. Please confirm you have associated an account with this Ledger.
getLedgerAccountIds.U2FNotSupported: U2F browser support is needed for Ledger. Please use Chrome, Opera or Firefox with U2F extension.

initiateZeroBalanceAccount.error: Something went wrong while initiating your account. Please try again.

initTwoFactor.ledgerEnabled: Ledger Hardware Wallet is enabled. To enable Two-Factor Authentication you need to disable Ledger Hardware Wallet first.

lockup.transferAllWithStakingPoolBalance: Unstake and withdraw all funds from the staking pool in order to transfer your remaining lockup balance to Wallet.

recoverAccountLink.error: Import of your account failed. Please try again or contact support for assistance.

recoverAccountSeedPhrase.errorInvalidSeedPhrase: No accounts were found for this passphrase.
recoverAccountSeedPhrase.errorNotAbleToImportAccount: Import of your account failed. Please try again or contact support for assistance.
recoverAccountSeedPhrase.errorSeedPhraseNotValid: The provided passphrase is not valid. Please check your passphrase and try again.

recoveryMethods.lastMethod: Cannot delete your last recovery method. Unless you have Ledger enabled, you need to keep at least one recovery method active to ensure recoverability of your account.
recoveryMethods.setupMethod: An error occurred. Please check your recovery method.

refreshAccountOwner.error: An error occured while loading your account. Some wallet data may not be up-to-date. Please try refreshing your browser.

sendFungibleToken.error: An error occurred. Your send transaction was cancelled.

setupRecoveryMessage.error: An error occurred while setting up your recovery method. Please try again!

staking.noWithdraw: Unable to withdraw pending balance from validator
staking.unableToCheckFAK: Sorry, we are not able to check if Validator has full access key.
staking.validatorHasFAK: Sorry, we are not allowing you to stake with Validator that has a full access key, for your safety.

disable2fa.desc: 2FA must be disabled before you can transfer an account to a new wallet.
disable2fa.title: Disable two-factor authentication

migrateAccounts.desc: The following accounts will be transferred:
migrateAccounts.title: We found ${count} active accounts

migrationSecret.desc: You'll need this password to securely import your accounts. Copy or write it down until you've completed transferring your accounts.
migrationSecret.title: Password required to import accounts

rotateKeys.desc:
For your security, we are going to generate a new passphrase and full access key for the below accounts.

Rotating your key will help protect your wallet and allow you to clean up your old full access keys after you transfer your accounts.
rotateKeys.title: Let’s secure your accounts

exportKey.title: Export private key?
exportKey.desc:
Never share your private key! Anyone with access to it will also have full access to your account.

Copy or download your private key for safekeeping.

selectWallet.descOne: You’ll be automatically redirected in 10 seconds. Once redirected, you’ll need to approve each account as it is added to your new wallet.
selectWallet.descTwo:
These wallets support automatically transferring accounts.

You can manually import an existing account to any wallet using your 12-word recovery phrase.
selectWallet.ledgerDisclaimer: Transfer to this wallet will exclude any ledger account(s) due to incompetibility.
selectWallet.title: Select a wallet to transfer accounts

redirect.title: Redirecting to ${wallet}
redirect.desc: You’ll be automatically redirected in 10 seconds. Once redirected, you’ll need to approve each account as it is added to your new wallet.

verifying.title: Verify your account is available
verifying.desc: Check your new wallet to make sure you have access to your account(s). After you confirm access, we’ll remove some of your old keys to keep your accounts safe.
verifying.disclaimer: I have access to my account in another wallet

cleanKeys.title: Clean up your keys
cleanKeys.desc: For your security, we highly recommend you remove most of your existing access keys.

logout.title: One last step
logout.desc:
As the last step, we are going clear out the keys stored on this browser for your security. You will be logged out of wallet.near.org and your keys will be removed.

Make sure you have access to your account in another wallet.

error.message: We were unable to add an additional Ledger key to your account. Please try again or re-import your Ledger account.

success.message: A new Ledger key was added to your account. You can now manage your accounts recovery methods using your Ledger device.

error.message: We were unable to add a new access key to your account. Please re-import your account to add a new wallet key.

success.header: Your account has been successfully imported!
success.message: Now that your account is active, a new access key has been added to your account to sign transactions in the wallet.

ledgerModal.confirmOnLedger: Confirm the action on your Ledger device.
ledgerModal.desc: Add a Ledger limited access key to the wallet to manage multiple recovery methods.
ledgerModal.title: Your account is now active!
